answers.answer: Hello cbell,We are volunteers, so be sure to talk with your pediatrician about your daughter's symptoms.Some folks with diabetes also have a tendency toward Celiac or Crohn's disease, which affect digestion.  Food allergies and stress are also common causes of stomach pain.  To find out what's going on, ask your daughter to help you keep good records of foods, beverages, activities, stress, health, and symptoms.  You can keep a simple notebook with days/times and comments that will help her pediatrician/endo identify patterns and evaluate what tests to consider.Good luck.  I hope that Olivea feels 100% very soon.

question: Our daughter Olivea was diagnosed at two years old. She is currently eleven and manages herself fairly well. She has been having terrible stomach pain and tightening for the past few days with no relief. I have heard that stomach pain and troubles with the digestive organs are common with diabetics. Is there anything or anyone who knows what this may be?
title: Stomach pain and tightening
